subject: AI & Agents
title: The Netflix Prize: Crowdsourcing AI Breakthroughs
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Netflix Prize: Crowdsourcing AI Breakthroughs usable.

hook.text: In 2006, Netflix offered one million dollars to anyone who could improve its recommendation algorithm by 10%.

buildup.text: Thousands of teams worldwide competed for three years using collaborative filtering and ensemble methods.

discovery.text: The winning team combined hundreds of models. The power was in blending, not in any single approach.

twist.text: Netflix never fully deployed the winning solution â€” the engineering cost outweighed the accuracy gain.

climax.text: The prize proved that open competition could accelerate AI research faster than any single lab.

punchline.text: A million dollars and a global race. The real prize was what everyone learned.
